alert.note: Alert for Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 6:22PM CDT until May 18 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Coke, Sterling and Tom Green. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, from Blackwell to Robert Lee to Carlsbad and Grape Creek. Movement was east at 15 mph. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Robert Lee, Blackwell, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Water Valley, Sanco, Carlsbad, Broome, Grape Creek, Silver, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, Us-87 Near The Coke-Tom Green County Line and Oak Creek Reservoir. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Ross Rd. crossing Bouzier Creek, Hamilton crossing, Graham Valley crossing, Walnut crossing Little Walnut Creek, Walnut crossing Walnut Creek, Fields crossing, Collier crossing, Hurley crossing, Sanco crossing Yellow Wolf Creek and Arledge crossing Yellow Wolf Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
